definitions: Past tense of shame: to make someone feel ashamed; to cause to feel shame.
Past tense of shame: to bring shame or disgrace upon; to dishonor.
Past tense of shame: to outdo or surpass in a way that makes the other seem inadequate.
examples: He shamed his family with his actions.
She was shamed by her poor performance.
The new building shamed all the older ones around it.
